definition: lit. has a name but no reality (idiom); exists only in name/nominal
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely

sentences.english: My father spent a busman's holiday working in his office.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸的假日“有名无实”，整个假期他都呆在办公室。

sentences.english: My father spent a busman's holiday working in his office.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸的节假日有名无实，整个假期他都呆在办公室。

sentences.english: Even some senior officials now say he is a mere figurehead.
sentences.chinese: 尽管一些资深官员说他只是个有名无实的人物。

sentences.english: The king was made a titular figure, and the post of Prime Minister was made powerful and hereditary.
sentences.chinese: 国王有名无实，而首相很有权力并实行世袭制。

sentences.english: Uncle Tom spent a busman's holiday working in his office.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆叔叔的假日有名无实，整个假期他都在办公室。

definition: the name remains, but the reality is gone (idiom)
(of a title, degree etc) illegitimately conferred
pinyin: ming2 bu5 zheng4 yan2 bu5 shun4

definition: with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be
a person's status
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
vacuous reputation/name without substance/in name only/so-called
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
sinecure/position with practically no obligations
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
the name does not correspond to reality (idiom); it doesn't live up to its reputation
to be officially wed
tantamount to/to be like
false reputation
power/authority
first wife/legal wife
